clinical_study.brief_title: Vasopressin to Prevent Hypotension During Beach Chair Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trials of Vasopressin for Prevention of Hypotension During Shoulder Surgery in Beach Chair Position Under General Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock: Patients undergoing surgery in beach chair position (BCP) are at risk for cerebral ischaemia. The impacts of arginine vasopressin (AVP) on haemodynamics and cerebral oxygenation are evaluated during surgery in BCP.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients undergoing shoulder surgery in BCP under general anaesthesia are randomly allocated to receive i.v. normal saline (control group) or AVP 0.05 or 0.07 U kg-1 (AVP group, n = 15 each) 2 min before moving into BCP. Mean arterial pressure (MAP), heart rate (HR), jugular venous bulb oxygen saturation (SjvO2) and regional cerebral tissue oxygen saturation (SctO2) are measured before (pre-sitting in supine position) and after patients assumed BCP.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: The magnitude of decrease of mean arterial pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (before positioning) and lowest value within 10 min into beach chair position
primary_outcome.description: Continuously measure mean arterial blood pressure before and after position change. Calculate the magnitude of maximum decrease of mean arterial pressure from baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 min after the positioning
secondary_outcome.description: Jugular venous oxygen saturation is continuously measured whether its saturation is decreased below 50% or/and 40% for longer than 5 min.

other_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 min after the position change
other_outcome.description: Continuously observe near-infrared spectroscopy measured cerebral oxygenation before and after beach chair position whether oxygen saturation decrease more than 20% from pre-sitting values

arm_group.description: Administer vasopressin 0.05 or 0.07 IU/kg before sitting position during propofol anesthesia.
Administer saline 10 ml (placebo) 2 min before beach chair position during propofol anesthesia
Administer vasopressin 0.05 or 0.07 IU/kg 2 min before beach chair position during sevoflurane anesthesia
Placebo (saline 10 ml) for vasopressin is administered 2 min before beach chair position during sevoflurane anesthesia

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing shoulder surgery in the beach chair position under the general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: elective arthroscopic shoulder surgery under general anesthesia in beach chair position
Exclusion Criteria: preexisting cerebrovascular diseases, history of orthostatic hypotension, age less than 18 yr, and the American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status IV or V
